items.title: Missing positional argument `parallel_builds` on pip 20.2
Slot members prevent class from being overrided
items.body:
Example code to reproduce:

```python
from pip_shims import Link
```
Traceback:
```pytb
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "d:/Workspace/pip-shims/temp.py", line 1, in <module>
    from pip_shims import (
  File "d:\workspace\pip-shims\src\pip_shims\shims.py", line 61, in __getattr__
  File "d:\workspace\pip-shims\src\pip_shims\models.py", line 759, in shim
    result = self.traverse(top_path)
  File "d:\workspace\pip-shims\src\pip_shims\models.py", line 751, in traverse
    result = shim.shim()
  File "d:\workspace\pip-shims\src\pip_shims\models.py", line 599, in shim
    return self.shim_class(imported, self.name_to_import)
  File "d:\workspace\pip-shims\src\pip_shims\models.py", line 544, in shim_class
    result = self._ensure_methods(result)
  File "d:\workspace\pip-shims\src\pip_shims\models.py", line 464, in _ensure_methods
    type_ = type(classname, (provided,), new_functions)
ValueError: '_parsed_url' in __slots__ conflicts with class variable
```

items.title: RequirementSet.cleanup() calls are no longer valid in pip 20.1
items.body: As of `pip>=20.1`, calls to `RequirementSet.cleanup()` are no longer valid due to the use of transient `RequirementSet` instances in the resolution process.  This will need to be rectified throughout the codebase including in `compat.resolve` and in tests

items.title: Resolver path changes in pip 20.1
items.body: In `pip>=20.1`, the path of the `Resolver` class will migrate from `legacy_resolve.Resolve` to `resolution.legacy.resolver.Resolver`

items.title: InstallRequirement.ensure_build_location() expects 'autodelete: bool' argument
items.body: Starting with `pip>=20.1`, `InstallRequirement.ensure_build_location()` will require an additional positional argument: `autodelete: bool`

items.title: Resolver.resolve function signature changes in pip 20.1
items.body: Starting with `pip>=20.1` calls to `Resolver.resolve` will move from accepting a `RequirementSet` instance to `root_reqs: List[InstallRequirement], check_supports_wheel: bool`.

items.title: Fix test failures
items.body: @techalchemy what are the specific current test failures that need fixing?

items.title: compat.get_session passes a tuple to pip where it should only pass the options group
items.body:
```pycon
>>> pip_compat.get_session(install_cmd=cmd, options=cmd.cmd_opts)                                                                                                             
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/home/techalchemy/.virtualenvs/requirementslib-JzdulSRB/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pip_shims/compat.py", line 416, in get_session
    session = install_cmd._build_session(options)  # type: ignore
  File "/home/techalchemy/.virtualenvs/requirementslib-JzdulSRB/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pip/_internal/cli/req_command.py", line 83, in _build_session
    assert not options.cache_dir or os.path.isabs(options.cache_dir)
AttributeError: 'OptionGroup' object has no attribute 'cache_dir'
```

items.title: make_distribution_for_install_requirement functionality is now under `distributions`
items.body: This function is the replacement for `make_abstract_dist` and is the last remaining change to account for in the pip 20 release

items.title: expose global_tempdir_manager and enter context during resolution
items.body: requirement preparation and unpacking requires globally managed temporary directories which are handled via a global `ExitStack` instance for reasons...?

items.title: Add build_wheel shim function
items.body: We should add a `build_wheel` shim function to build wheels from `InstallRequirement` or `Iterable[InstallRequirement]`.

items.title: Add new wheel builder function support
items.body: `build`, `_build_one`, and `_build_one_inside_env` are now available as top-level functions off of the `wheel_builder` module

items.title: The Wheel class has been removed
items.body: After 19.3.1 it seems pip has opted to remove the `Wheel` class, which didn't do much so we can just provide that functionality as a shim

items.title: Downloader class has moved on master branch
items.body: the `Downloader` class is now located at `pip._internal.network.download.Downloader`

items.title: Remove unnecessary dependency on vistir
Add Downloader to shim_unpack implementation
items.body:
pip has added a `Downloader` class and it is required to instantiate it and pass it to the `unpack_url` function now. It takes two arguments, `session` and `progress_bar`.

Overall I have no idea what the plan is or if anyone has sat down and produced a 'here is the final outcome we are aiming at' document because all of these tiny little classes are going to have their own cost I feel, not the least of which is that they incur the cost of just moving stuff around and people do use the internal api.  As someone who tries to support that it's getting pretty frustrating knowing it's been like 2 years since I started asking to share code and the only thing that continues to actually seem logical is if there is a way to completely sever all ties to pip...

items.title: Missing git tag for 0.3.4 release
items.body: It would be nice to keep PyPI releases and git tags in sync :)

items.title: Future Design
Update paths of moved items
items.body:
The following items have moved:
- `SafeFileCache` -> `network.cache`
- `Link` -> `models.link.Link`
- `path_to_url` -> `utils.url`
- `url_to_path` -> `utils.url`
- `SourceDistribution` -> `distributions.source.legacy`

Other notable changes:
- For some reason the resolver no longer accepts `isolated`, `wheel_cache` as arguments and can no longer generate install requirements. Instead you must pass in a partial function yourself that can generate install requirements:

```python
index_urls = [pip_options.index_url] + pip_options.extra_index_urls
search_scope = SearchScope.create(
    find_links=pip_options.find_links, index_urls=index_urls
)
link_collector = LinkCollector(session=session, search_scope=search_scope)
selection_prefs = SelectionPreferences(
    True,
    allow_all_prereleases=False,
    format_control=None,
    prefer_binary=False,
    ignore_requires_python=False,
)
target_python = TargetPython()
candidate_prefs = CandidatePreferences(
    prefer_binary=selection_prefs.prefer_binary,
    allow_all_prereleases=selection_prefs.allow_all_prereleases,
)
finder_args = {
    "candidate_prefs": candidate_prefs,
    "link_collector": link_collector,
    "target_python": target_python,
    "allow_yanked": selection_prefs.allow_yanked,
    "format_control": selection_prefs.format_control,
    "ignore_requires_python": selection_prefs.ignore_requires_python,
}
finder = PackageFinder(**finder_args)
build_dir = tmpdir.mkdir("build_dir")
source_dir = tmpdir.mkdir("source_dir")
download_dir = tmpdir.mkdir("download_dir")
wheel_download_dir = CACHE_DIR.mkdir("wheels")
wheel_cache = WheelCache(USER_CACHE_DIR, FormatControl(None, None))
kwargs = {
    "build_dir": build_dir.strpath,
    "src_dir": source_dir.strpath,
    "download_dir": download_dir.strpath,
    "wheel_download_dir": wheel_download_dir.strpath,
    "wheel_cache": wheel_cache,
}
ireq = InstallRequirement.from_editable(
    "git+https://github.com/urllib3/urllib3@1.23#egg=urllib3"
)
ireq.populate_link(finder, False, False)
ireq.ensure_has_source_dir(kwargs["src_dir"])
make_install_req = partial(
    install_req_from_req_string,
    isolated=False,
    wheel_cache=wheel_cache,
    # use_pep517=use_pep517,
)
resolver_kwargs = {
    "finder": finder,
    "session": session,
    "upgrade_strategy": "to-satisfy-only",
    "make_install_req": make_install_req,
    "force_reinstall": False,
    "ignore_dependencies": False,
    "ignore_requires_python": False,
    "ignore_installed": True,
    "use_user_site": False,
}
```

- The Wheel Builder no longer accepts a finder
- `unpack_url` no longer accepts `only_download` as an argument

And probably most kind of strangely there are now about 5 objects you need build and pass into a `PackageFinder` rather than simply passing in arguments:
- `SearchScope`: seems to just specify `find_links` and `index_urls`, is its own object in its own file
- `LinkCollector`: accepts a `session` and a `SearchScope`, not too sure since I thought it just accumulated links but I'm guessing now that it actually queries for them
- `SelectionPreferences`: Accepts `allow_all_prereleases`, `format_control`, `prefer_binary`, `ignore_requires_python`
- `TargetPython`: Accepts a bunch of arguments describing the valid tags to include
- `CandidatePreferences`: Takes `allow_all_prereleases` and `prefer_binary` from `SelectionPreferences`
- `PackageFinder`: Takes `candidate_prefs`, `link_collector`, `target_python`, `allow_yanked`, `format_control`, and `ignore_requires_python` -- these last build `SelectionPreferences` so I dion't know why they made an exception here rather than demanding the whole object be built first...

Finders no longer carry a `session` instance either, which we used to use for persistence

Basically everything in pip is super unstable atm and currently trending toward lots of 'providers' and i'm suspecting we will see some factories soon :)

items.title: Replace or shim missing exposed functions
items.body:
These functions are missing and must be shimmed:
- `is_file_url`
- `is_archive_file`

items.title: Expose new necessary endpoints
items.body:
New endpoints need to be exposed to use pip going forward:
- `SessionCommandMixin`
- `CandidatePreferences`
- `LinkCollector`
- `LinkEvaluator`
- `TargetPython`
- `SearchScope`
- `SelectionPreferences`
- `CandidateEvaluator`
- `install_req_from_req_string`

items.title: Allow instantiation of Command objects again
items.body:
- Shim `Command` objects with default arguments so they can be instantiated again
- Add session mixin to continue use for session building

items.title: `VCSSupport` has moved
items.body: `VcsSupport` has moved from `vcs.__init__.py` to `vcs.versioncontrol` as of `pip>19.1.1`

items.title: CandidateEvaluator class has been added to PackageFinder
items.body: `PackageFinder` no longer accepts arguments for `allow_all_prereleases` but the new class does allow for passing in a target python version as well as `prefer_binary` and `ignore_requires_python`.

items.title: Add shim for commands.freeze.DEV_PKGS and utils.compat.stdlib_pkgs
items.body: pip-tools uses both of these

items.title: THANK YOU!
items.body: that is all. :-)

items.title: Provide API for PyPI model access
items.body: `pip._internal.models.index.PyPI` and `pip.models.index.PyPI` (pre pip 10)

items.title: Add more shims for exceptions and errors
items.body:
@techalchemy commented on [Sat Oct 06 2018](https://github.com/sarugaku/vistir/issues/15)

Include long-supported errors such as `InstallationError`, `UninstallationError`, etc

items.title: Add FrozenRequirement
items.body:
pypa/pipenv#2925. pipdeptree needs `get_installed_distributions` and `FrozenRequirement`; the former is already provided. This is how pipdeptree imports them:

```
try:
    from pip._internal import get_installed_distributions
    from pip._internal.operations.freeze import FrozenRequirement
except ImportError:
    from pip import get_installed_distributions, FrozenRequirement
```

items.title: from_editable and from_line are no longer part of InstallRequirement
items.body:
As of pip `18.1` these have changed in the following way:

- `InstallRequirement.from_editable` is now `pip._internal.req.constructors.install_req_from_editable`
- `InstallRequirement.from_line` is now `pip._internal.req.constructors.install_req_from_line`

items.title: Update location of FormatControl to new location in pip
items.body: `FormatControl` location is now in `pip._internal.models.format_control` as of pip `18.1`

items.title: Add pip 18.1 and pip master to CI builds
items.body: - CI Builds don't build against master which is why things are broken

items.title: pip 18.1 moved (removed?) _strip_extras
items.body: pypa/pipenv#2924.

items.title: Add UninstallPathSet shim
We should load modules lazily on import
items.body: - Replace modules at runtime with classes that handle `getattribute` logic properly

items.title: Invalid pip versions are not being excluded correctly
items.body: Sort ordering logic is backwards

items.title: WheelCache old location is wrong
items.body: WheelCache was in `pip.wheel` before pip 10, not `pip.cache`.

items.title: Everything is None on pip 9
items.body:
```
$ mkdir pip-shims-test
$ cd pip-shims-test/
$ pipenv install pip-shims "pip<10"
[snipped]

$ pipenv run python
>>> import pip_shims
>>> print(pip_shims.VcsSupport)
None
>>> import pip.vcs
>>> print(pip.vcs.VcsSupport)
<class 'pip.vcs.VcsSupport'>
>>>
```
